reviews.review:
I played Team Fortress 2 and CS: Source for a LONG time before I tried this out and I must say this game is phenomenal! It's kinda similar to CS: Source but the gunplay is a lot more fun. Here we have lots of recoil and a class system. This game is a lot more strategic than Counter-Strike and it requires you to look at the map often and assume the enemy's position. It's definitely harder than CS: Source and requires more skill. This game is like the holy grail for World War 2 enthusiasts. By the way, why is this game considered Team Fortress 1 when there's actually a game called Team Fortress: Classic?

There are still quite some servers running with people playing 24/7. If you're unfamiliar with the weapons, play on that one gungame server to learn them all because you really must learn to use all the weapons in the game. In my opinion, the STG-44 and it's Allies Counterpart BAR are the two hardest weapons to use. My favorite class is definitely Axis Rifleman because the Kar98k rocks and kills with a single shot. It's like a noscope sniper. For some reason, I don't really like the M1 Garand because it's the same but worse. In this game, Sniper is actually the easiest class to get kills with especially if you use camouflage to hide.

The maps in this game are awesome too, as expected from Valve. I just think the colors are a bit "washed-out" and gray, boring. It must be the world war 2 theme. They should really make a Day of Defeat: Source 2 because there's not a game quite like it and everyone would like a new Day of Defeat. It's definitely more fun than CS: Source because the guns feel a lot more real and fun to use. Although CS: Source has more gamemodes going on like bhop and minigames and all that. I still prefer this game. It's a lot of fun to play this game. I got the achievements fast by using achievement maps and console commands, don't judge me, I go the way of least resistance. This is a 10/10 classic game.
Holds up after time
Esse jogo √© muito bom e se jogar com os amigos fica ainda mais divertido. Eu joguei com os meus e nos divertimos muito. Recomendo muito esse jogo.
The gameplay absolutely holds up in 2020, I recommend going to gamebannana and installing modboy to overhaul the visuals and freshen up the game

One of the best game's to run competitively. Much better than Counter Strike for example. Too bad that the community died out and no new updates came. Still worth a play now again while being drunk or on coke.

I have fond memories of playing dod with friends way back when it started as a Half-Life mod. Now, almost 20 years later, I have rediscovered it as dod source and spent another 25 hours in it so far. I was delighted to see so many active servers maintained with a steady player base. The controls are simple and the gameplay mechanics aren't very complex making it very easy to pick up but hard to master, as so many other reviewers have already stated. In many ways I have always considered this to be the WW2 counterpart to the original counter-strike, I still feel this holds true. Nostalgia may be a factor here, but definitely worth a (re)visit in my opinion.
Loads of fun.  You would swear this is Call of Duty at first glance.

Used to be my favorite game about 8 years ago. I was so glad to see that there is still an avid community online and im also surprised how well the game has help up. I am once again addicted to it! Perhaps the best part is that because its an older game, it has an older player based (20s to 30s from what I can tell) so if you like shooters but dont like playing with younger players, this is perfect.

Don't get me wrong, I enjoy playing the game, but I really wouldn't recommend buying it. The shooting in this game has a very large learning curve and the actual WWII maps are limited, with the rest being geometric mazes colored orange or blue on active servers. This game has not had any Valve attention or tender love and care in over a decade and then some. Sad really, there was potential, just wasn't tended too.
